Hi
Can someone help me understand how to trigger a workflow through an API?

Hi ,

We are facing some confusion regarding how opt-ins are managed in HubSpot, specifically the difference between *contact properties* and *preferences handled through the Preference Center*.

Currently, we are updating the  *opt-in* via the API by modifying the internal contact property However, we understood that opt-ins managed by the Preference Center, use a *specific data field* that is not a standard contact property and cannot be edited directly.

We have the following questions:

*What is the correct way to update an opt-in managed via the Preference Center using the API?*

*How does HubSpot handle synchronization between a contact property "opt-in" and the actual opt-in status in the Preference Center?*

*If an internal contact property  is updated, does this automatically affect the Preference Center opt-in status?*

*Is there a dedicated API or process to modify opt-in preferences stored in system properties like ?*

And my last question would :

*Is it possible to change the unsubscribe from all value via an API ? if yes how ?* 

Thanks in advance for your help!
What is the trigger for your workflow?  Using an API you could set that condition in the appropriate record which would then trigger the workflow.
iirc when I tried a year or two ago I ran into issues
Thanks Dan, wasnt sure if things had changed and asked a few people outside of this slack channel and it is clear HubSpot requires a full admin license.

Hi Channel,
Does anyone know if there an API I can call to seed these values in a CTA Popup? We have many entries and don't want to do this manually

Is there a master list of HubSpot portal time zone values available anywhere? I ask because there's some slight differences between how HS records timezones (e.g., `US/Eastern`) and how our internal system handles time zones (e.g., `America/New York`) and I'd like to create equivalency mappings.

The use case is a bit unique, for reasons I wont get into, there is a WordPress frontend with a rest api that processes the request and outputs a response specifically tailored to their systems. So the WP API, sends the request to HubSpot to retrieve the data, processes it and then returns its own API response.
How long is it currently taking to process 10,000 records?

Reposting here if this is a better channel for the *Custom Javascript Form Embed Code API*
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CBA9UA4EN/p1739321160587269>

Yeah it takes awhile, like 50 seconds. But thats what the client wants. Meanwhile support did get back to me and for anyone following this is the response.

1 - you can make multiple searches, you will need to make sure the response is ordered and then when you get to the last allowed page, create a new search with the same criteria of the original search and just ANDing with the last object record. Here is an example: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/How-to-fetch-more-than-10-000-records-using-HubSpot-API/m-p/571539/highlight/true>

2 - you can also use the <https://8-04.na1.hs-service-engage.com/Ctc/41+23284/8-04/Jll2-6qcW7Y8-PT6lZ3l_VmL9xT748ChfN1tbyQ8C7sGMW5mY4q_4p4bFxW9dKMbT7QGv-CW54s-tS4nww0qVJb-bR8JYHbJW50ndL82WFcMTW8CXspJ5CSnQBVXmsxj2KFWY6W9f3yMt73l0Q8VPCXLS5q25vjW1f9xzM5Y4dpYVrbYD95w6Bz6F2l874CnVz0N2md6XhyRdq0W3DnXvP3_TKljW3GbSX56xPkd2VPDhxF3npm_YW89XZ-W2VQVTJW4Xkgyn8Dn-2DW2Q3BcW8npKNvF7QGw03vS90W2xsbZ37TBDkWW1659L11n3c8cW4kccgw45xhd9W6hzkmw2jVYSFdjbGnR04|exports API> and plug your search criteria.
